name: Tinyauth
short_desc: The simplest way to protect your apps with a login screen.
author: steveiliop56
description: Tinyauth is a simple authentication middleware that adds a simple login screen or OAuth with Google, Github and any provider to all of your docker apps. It supports all the popular proxies like Traefik, Nginx and Caddy.

form_fields.label: App URL
form_fields.hint: The URL tinyauth will use to redirect you to the login screen and back, this needs to match with the local domain or the expose domain, e.g. 'https://tinyauth.example.com'.

form_fields.label: Users
form_fields.hint: A comma separated list of users in the format username:bcrypt-hash, make sure to use double dollar signs ($$) in the bcrypt hash to escape them.

form_fields.label: Github Client ID
form_fields.hint: Fill this with your Github client ID if you want to enable Github login.

form_fields.label: Github Client Secret
form_fields.hint: Fill this with your Github client secret if you want to enable Github login.

form_fields.label: Google Client ID
form_fields.hint: Fill this with your Google client ID if you want to enable Google login.

form_fields.label: Google Client Secret
form_fields.hint: Fill this with your Google client secret if you want to enable Google login.

form_fields.label: OAuth Whitelist
form_fields.hint: A comma separated list of emails that are allowed to use the OAuth login, leave empty to allow all emails.

form_fields.label: Title
form_fields.hint: Set a custom title for the login screen, e.g. 'My Homelab'.

form_fields.label: Disable Continue
form_fields.hint: Check this if you want to disable the continue screen and immediately redirect to your app after you login.
